alert.note: Alert for Mora; Quay (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 27 at 3:37AM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM MDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast New Mexico, including the following counties, in east central New Mexico, Quay. In northeast New Mexico, Harding, Mora and San Miguel. * WHEN...Until 645 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 337 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mosquero, Logan, Conchas Dam, Conchas Lake State Park, Conchas, Variadero, Maes, Trujillo, Ute Lake State Park, Bell Ranch and Trementina. - This includes the following highways... State Road 104 between Mile Markers 15 and 98. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly or mountainous terrain there are numerous of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
